title: Shafali’s unbeaten fifty helps India cruise past Sri Lanka
byline: The Indian chase defined the concept of a walk in the park, with Shafali Verma’s scintillating unbeaten 69 off 34 balls anchoring a 129-run pursuit that did the job with 49 balls to spare.

title: Submit information by January 6 for cyclone ‘Ditwah’ relief, Ministry says
byline: The Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has launched a post-disaster registration process to provide aid to women and children affected by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: Drop in foreign job seekers rings alarm bells – ALFEA
byline: The number of Sri Lankans seeking foreign employment has declined sharply, the Association of Licensed Foreign Employment Agencies (ALFEA) said yesterday, blaming fraud and mismanagement by politicians of the previous government.

title: WHO-recognized drug testing lab in the offing
byline: Amid renewed concerns over the country’s lack of a WHO-accredited laboratory, Sri Lanka has begun upgrading its drug testing facilities to meet World Health Organization (WHO) accreditation standards.

title: Absence of AG during post disaster situation disturbing, Harsha tells President
byline: Committee on Public Finance (COPF) Chairman Harsha de Silva in a letter addressed to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has informed him that absence of an Auditor General during a post disaster situation is disturbing.

title: Student who films elephant cruelty complains of injustice
byline: A university student who filmed a shocking incident of wild elephant cruelty in the Sippikulam–Ambagahawela area of the Mihintale Police Division in Anuradhapura is facing serious difficulties after wildlife officers seized his mobile phone and have yet to return it, relatives said.

title: Pakistan National Carrier Sale Gets Offer for $482 Million
byline: Pakistan’s attempt to sell its national flag carrier Pakistan International Airlines Corp. has received a successful bid, marking a watershed moment for the country that has been attempting to privatize the airline since the 1990s.

title: Christmas carols by SriLankan Airlines staff delight passengers at BIA
byline: In the lead-up to the Christmas season, employees of SriLankan Airlines presented a special Christmas carol singing programme for arriving and departing passengers at the Transit Terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), last night (23).

title: Libya’s army chief killed in air crash in Turkey
byline: The Libyan army chief has been killed in an air crash in Turkey, Libya’s prime minister has said.

title: Japanese golf legend Masashi ‘Jumbo’ Ozaki dies at 78
byline: Masashi ’Jumbo’ Ozaki, one of only two Japanese golfers to be inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame, died at 78 after a battle with colon cancer, the Japan Golf Tour Organisation (JGTO) said on Wednesday.

title: India and China’s cooperation will strengthen the voice of the voiceless in the Global South: Sajith
byline: India and China should cooperate to strengthen the voice of the voiceless in the Global South, Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: MP Archchuna arrested
byline: Colombo Fort Police arrested MP Ramanathan Archchuna today following a warrant issued by the Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: T-56 rifle recovered from abandoned vehicle in Ragama
byline: Ragama Police recovered a T-56 assault rifle along with ammunition from an abandoned vehicle in the Pahalawatta area last night.

title: US denies visas to ex-EU commissioner and others over social media rules
byline: The US State Department said it would deny visas to five people, including a former EU commissioner, for seeking to ’’coerce’’ American social media platforms into suppressing viewpoints they oppose.

title: Tourist family criticises Sri Lanka’s visa extension process
byline: A tourist family visiting Sri Lanka has spoken out about difficulties they faced while trying to extend their visa, calling the process “the most painful experience ever.”

title: MP Archchuna released on bail
byline: Jaffna District Parliamentarian Ramanathan Archchuna has been released on anticipatory bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today.

title: China’s CNOOC makes second big oil find in Bohai Sea
byline: China’s oil major CNOOC Limited  said on Wednesday (Dec 24) it has discovered an oilfield with proved in-place volumes exceeding 100 million tons of oil equivalent in its second big find in the central Bohai Sea.

title: Special bus and train services launched for festive season
byline: Special bus and train services from Colombo to outstation areas and back to the capital were launched today (24) for the festive season under the supervision of the National Transport Commission (NTC).

title: Japanese golf legend Masashi ‘Jumbo’ Ozaki dies at 78
byline: Masashi ’Jumbo’ Ozaki, one of only two Japanese golfers to be inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame, died at 78 after a battle with colon cancer, the Japan Golf Tour Organisation (JGTO) said on Wednesday.

title: Three new airlines cleared to enter Indian market after IndiGo disruption
byline: Air travellers are set to get more choice in the domestic aviation market, with three new airlines preparing to take to Indian skies in the near future.

title: Market edges higher in sideways trade
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) extended its modest recovery for a second consecutive session, with both key indices closing slightly higher. Despite the positive close, trading activity remained largely range-bound, with the market lacking a clear directional bias amid the absence of supportive macroeconomic cues.

title: Public warned against using unfamiliar water bodies during festive season
byline: Health authorities have advised the public to be vigilant when using unfamiliar water bodies during the ongoing festive season, citing safety risks arising from recent adverse weather conditions.

title: Police constable injured in accidental shooting at Ambalangoda Police Station
byline: A police constable was injured in a firearm accident at the Ambalangoda Police Station this evening, police said.

title: Drivers’ cooperation vital to ease expressway congestion: RDA chief
byline: The cooperation of drivers is crucial to reducing congestion on Sri Lanka’s expressways, Director General of the Road Development Authority (RDA) Wimal Kandambi said today.

title: Heavy rains above 50mm on the cards
byline: Fairly heavy rainfall exceeding 50 mm is likely at some places in the Galle, Matara, Kalutara and Ratnapura districts, the Meteorology Department said.

title: NPP accused of changing clock to win budget in Horana
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) led Horana Urban Council has fraudulently won the budget proposal by changing the time on the clock, Samagi Jana Balawegaya MP Ajith P. Perera alleged today.

title: Ho Ho No! Santa pulled over for speeding
byline: Santa is speeding through his Christmas deliveries, but a sheriff in Ohio had to stop him on Saturday for ’’flying a little too fast’’ with Mrs Claus through Fulton County.

title: Three new airlines cleared to enter Indian market after IndiGo disruption
byline: Air travellers are set to get more choice in the domestic aviation market, with three new airlines preparing to take to Indian skies in the near future.

title: China’s CNOOC makes second big oil find in Bohai Sea
byline: China’s oil major CNOOC Limited  said on Wednesday (Dec 24) it has discovered an oilfield with proved in-place volumes exceeding 100 million tons of oil equivalent in its second big find in the central Bohai Sea.
